p: In this study, extract and fraction from Myristica lowiana, a dioecious flowering tree of the family Myristicaceae, were investigated for their capacities to inhibit plasmid conjugation in E. coli a process that utilizes bacterial type-IV secretion systems to transfer genetic material, including antimicrobial resistance genes, between donor and recipient cells [ 10]. In addition, the extract and fraction were investigated for their antibacterial activities, cytotoxicity, and their phytochemical constituents.
